result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin C Lutz

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:18 a.m.
Intern Abigail Kincheloe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Justin C Lutz in court.  
Defendant requests that the Court appoint an attorney.
Court will appoint an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant is to pay $50.00 per month commencing 12-1-2022.
Court sets another hearing date.
Court advises the defendant to go to WCS to address his outstanding WCS fees for GP monitoring after court.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance report dated 10-19-2022 received and filed.

9:22 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Peter Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Justin C Lutz in court. 
Court indicates that the defendant is to go to the Public Defender's Office to see if he qualifies for representation.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin C Lutz
Current: C/O Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2022)
Prior: 5600 N 95th St #6, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.

4:59 PM Defendant Justin C Lutz in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Attorney Amanda Nimmer appears as friend of the court.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
